lines: You are getting dressed one day and notice a small red mark on your lip. Could it be some kind of disease? You think about all the boys you've kissed in the past month and decide to kill anyone who has given you a terminal disease.
Nothing to worry about. It's just a cold sore.
Don't worry. It's just a cold sore.
Doesn't anything alarm you? It was only a cold sore. Just what you thought. It's a good thing you had it checked.
It's only a cold sore, but you worry about it until it goes away. Calmness decreases.

Thinking about it in your state of mind makes it itch constantly. You are convinced that your lips will dry up and flake right off your face, yet you still won't go to the doctor. It's only a cold sore. It goes away in a few days,
but it always pays to get these things checked by a doctor. You could have given yourself a heart attack worrying about it.
You are using the defense mechanism of denial -- don't think about it, and it will go away. This time, as it happens, it does go away. Next time, you might not be so lucky.
